#summary Details on setDefaultFailOverNotificationEmail() API function
#sidebar ApiFunctions

Call this function to set a failover email address. This address will be used after
5 unsuccess sending trials of your notification.

For more informations about Delcampe's notifications, see [Notifications].

=== Call ===

 * syntax : setDefaultNotificationEmail(string token, string destination)

 * parameter 1 : _string_ : secret token
 * parameter 2 : _string_ : valid email address

=== Response ===

 * response : _array_ : the response is always an array of 2 elements
  * element 1 : _boolean_ : true (if call ok) or false (if call not ok)
  * element 2 : _string_  : message, giving you more information on the function call result 

 * example : 
  * if call of the function is ok, the return will always be like this :
   * array(true, 'Your default failover notification email has been saved!')
  * if call of the function is not ok, the message will differ :
   * array(false, 'The asked destination type is not valid!')
   * array(false, 'The asked destination seems to be invalid!')

 * notification : none

=== Code example (PHP) ===
{{{
//FUNCTION CALL
$objSoapClient = new SoapClient('http://api.delcampe.net/soap.php?wsdl');
list($success, $token) = $objSoapClient->authenticateUser('MyPersonalApiKey');

if (true === $success) {
  $return = $objSoapClient->setDefaultFailOverNotificationEmail($token, 'john.doo@mysite.com');
}
}}}
